v1.1.0 (Changelog)

General

  • Installation

    cwc makes it easy for you to start developing your second screen applications. We have developed the framework so that minimal setup is required but hightly customisable.

  • Connecting

    When you have installed the cwc node server, connecting clinet so that they can shear bidrectinal data can be acomplised is just a few steps.

  • Hooks

    Hooks are the building blocks of the cwc object allowing everything to connect by providing a way of defining callback functionality for series of events. Hooks can also be used to invoke hooks created on clients within the same cluster group.

Components

  • Viewport Scroll

    Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry’s standard dummy text ever since the 1500s

  • Pullbars

    — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — —

  • Navgroup & Navitems

    The Navgroup is a flexible, powerful component for navigation around big screen experience. You can quickly build simply to complex navigation structure to your application, allowing your users move around freely using keyboard events.

  • Gesture Pad

    4 or 8 way directional touch or swipe pad, perfect if you need more dynamic movement around around your application.

  • Directional pad

    A 1-way or 5-way Directional pad is perfect for games movement, user interfaces or if you want to have 4 buttons on a controller.

  • Analog controller

Documentation

Controller feedback data

last updated: Jan 24, 2016

The Navgroup is a flexible, powerful component for navigation around big screen experiance. You can quickly build simply to complex navigation structure to your application, allowing your users move around freely using keyboard events.

Information returned back to controller Hooks.

No. Return keys Return values Pullbar Analog pad DPad GesturePad
01. compass_rose The direction the user is moving the controller ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔
02. cartesian_coordinate Cartesian coordinates of x and y ✔ ✔   ✔
03. axis_direction in, out, static ✔ ✘   ✘
04. direction UP, RIGHT, DOWN, LEFT ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔
06. angle in, out, static ✔ ✘ ✘ ✘
05. delta Cartesian coordinates of x and y ✔ ✔   ✔

01. Compass rose

compass_rose is the movment given as

No. Movment type Compass rose
01. Move up N
02. Move up right NE
03. Move right E
04. Move down right SE
05. Move down S
06. Move down left SW
07. Move left W
08. Move up left NW

02. Cartesian coordinate

Table below otulines Cartesian coordinate that will be return by a support controler.

No. Movment type Cartesian coordinate
01. Move up Values 0 to -1.0 on y axis.
02. Move down Values 0 to 1.0 on y axis.
03. Move left Values 0 to -1.0 on x axis.
04. Move right Values 0 to 1.0 on x axis.

03. Axis direction

Table below otulines the axis direction that will be return by a support controler.

No. Movment type Cartesian coordinate
01. In User is moving in towards the centre of the Controller feedback data.
02. Out User is moving in away from the centre of the Controller feedback data.
03. Static Moving in the same direction.

04. Direction
